An R&D group director approves a major program's charter. Although the director has a high level of understanding of the program's scope, they are unsure of how the program manager can be successful in delivering the program's commitments.
What should the program manager do to align stakeholders with planning and monitoring the program's progress?

A. Establish high-level program milestones
B. Develop an accountability matrix, and assign program roles and responsibilities
C. Generate a supplier management plan to identify external stakeholders
D. Create a communications management plan, and establish reporting formats

Selected Answer: A
A is the right answer.

Selected Answer: D
D. Create a communications management plan, and establish reporting formats.

A communications management plan is essential for ensuring that all stakeholders, including the R&D group director, are kept informed about the program's progress and performance. It outlines how information will be disseminated, the frequency and types of communication, the stakeholders' information needs, and the reporting formats that will be used. Establishing clear reporting formats will provide the director and other stakeholders with the necessary information to gauge the program's success and make informed decisions.

questions.question_text:
The program manager wants to increase the team's commitment to the program objectives.
The program manager should do which of the following?

choices.A: Work with the sponsor to identify the organization's best practices.
choices.B: Work with the program stakeholders and program management office to identify the organization's best practices.
choices.D: Work with the sponsor, program stakeholders, and the program management office to identify the organization's best practices.
choices.C: Work with the program management office to identify the organization's best practices.

discussion.content:
D. Work with the sponsor, program stakeholders, and the program management office to identify the organization's best practices.

Involving the sponsor, stakeholders, and the PMO ensures a comprehensive approach to identifying best practices that can enhance team commitment. The sponsor brings a strategic perspective and can help ensure the program aligns with the organization's goals. Stakeholders provide diverse insights and help ensure that the program meets their needs, which can increase buy-in and commitment. The PMO can offer methodologies, tools, and processes that have been proven successful in the organization. Together, they can help establish a culture of excellence and align the program team with the objectives that are critical to the program's success.

The program master schedule is the top-level program planning document that defines the individual component schedules and dependencies among program components (individual components and program-level activities) required to achieve the program goals. It should include those component milestones that represent an output to the program or
share interdependency with other components.
The program master schedule should also include activities that are unique to the program including, but not limited to, activities related to stakeholder engagement, program-level risk mitigation, and program-level reviews. The program
master schedule determines the timing of individual components, enables the program manager to determine when
benefits will be delivered by the program, and identifies external dependencies of the program.
